column3: Concept ACK. You have to explicitly opt out of  `--previous-releases` on Travis, because `PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR` is created and cached for all machines.

tACK fab56c1a6e95b75f0dacb2d7301ac0fec9a310d5\n\nIt would be nice if you could still opt-out without having to move the releases folder. This can be useful when a new version is added and I can't be bothered to download it.

> It would be nice if you could still opt-out without having to move the releases folder. This can be useful when a new version is added and I can't be bothered to download it.\n\nIf this auto-detection behavior is too brittle, we should simply remove it. It seems odd to have default values depend on the presence of directories or files on the hard disk.

> If this auto-detection behavior is too brittle, we should simply remove it. It seems odd to have default values depend on the presence of directories or files on the hard disk.\n\nThat's annoying. Now you have to add `--previous-releases` every time to run those tests. Checking the presence of `/releases` for the default was better. We can always improve the error messages a bit, e.g. show whi
